content.body: I'm planning to experiment with a DWARF-style encoding for scopes, similar to what Nick Fitzgerald proposed with the "env" proposal. If that ends up being smaller than the current "scopes" encoding, that would be even better since it's more future proof than what we have now.

Playing around with some encoding formats:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1lAPxQkIk1Kmm9E7NSY4Vfu_aAZl72JJgCCEyVWygpYA/edit?usp=sharing
I think Simon and I arrived at roughly the same encoding format
TLDR: we can shave 9% off TSC’s `mappings` by switching to 8-bit VLQ, 13% by removing the comma/semicolons in the mappings with a packed format, and 24% if we do both.
content.formatted_body: TLDR: we can shave 9% off TSC’s mappings by switching to 8-bit VLQ, 13% by removing the comma/semicolons in the mappings with a packed format, and 24% if we do both.

content.body: But, GZIP is smarter than me and it’s a pretty meager 1% change after compression.
